definition: to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: But another no-show was perhaps more important.
sentences.chinese: 但是，另一个失约者也许更为重要。

sentences.english: I hope you weren't too upset at my missing our meeting.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你没因为我的失约而太生气。

sentences.english: After waiting for two hours, John began to realize that Helen had stood him up.
sentences.chinese: 等了两个小时以后，约翰开始意识到海伦失约了。

sentences.english: I can't believe that you stood me up.
sentences.chinese: 我简直不敢相信你居然失约。

sentences.english: You'd better not break your appointment.
He went, but missed many appointments; she refused.
sentences.chinese: 孩子来过，但失约了很多次，他母亲则从未露面。

sentences.english: I apologized to him for having broken my promise.
sentences.chinese: 我因失约而向他表歉意。

sentences.english: Jim said he'd be at the station, but he stood me up.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆说他要去车站的，但他失约了。

sentences.english: You must stand me up on purpose.

definition: lit. to eat one's words/to break a promise/to go back on one's word/to renege/unsworn testimony
not on time/late (public transport, airlines)/overdue/behind schedule/delayed
to dawdle/to go slow deliberately/to fizzle out/to have all one's hopes dashed/(Tw) to have a soak in a hot spring
to see each other/to meet in person
unworthy/to let down/I'm sorry/excuse me/pardon me/if you please/sorry? (please repeat)
to come to an agreement/to complete negotiations
